title: How to Create 3D Jars and Vases

steps.headline: Identify which items would look good with that 3-D effect.
Locate your hot glue gun and plenty of wax sticks.
steps.description: You will be writing sayings or creating designs with the hot glue gun on the item. Depending on how large of a design or word you plan to use will dictate how much glue you will need.

steps.headline: Purchase a can (or more) of spray paint to cover the item.
steps.description: While shopping for spray paint explain to the hardware or craft store employee what you are trying to do to ensure you purchase the kind of spray paint that will deliver the best results. Some spray paints work better on certain surfaces.

steps.headline: Decide what you want to write or draw.
steps.description: Do a sketch first to make sure you like the writing or design style. The good news about drawing with a hot glue gun is if you don’t like it, you can wipe away the hot glue immediately (you may have to peel it off if it dries).

steps.headline: Heat up the hot glue gun and insert a wax stick.
steps.description: You want to make sure your glue gun is red hot before use.

steps.headline: Draw/write your design on your item.
steps.description:
It may be a little difficult to see the actual writing or design since the glue is transparent. Consider creating your design in a well lit area so you can see exactly what you are doing. Allow ample dry time for the glue gun design. Even allowing it to set for up to 24 hours is a good idea as painting over the wet glue could ruin your project. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fe\/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fe\/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Prepare an area for spray painting.
steps.description: Cover surfaces with newspaper and make sure the room is well ventilated. Consider completing the project outdoors if possible.

steps.headline: Paint the object.
steps.description:
Make sure your spray is even and fully covers the object. You may want to add a few coats of paint depending on the type of surface and item. Allow paint to dry before adding the item to your room décor. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a4\/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a4\/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

text:
Choose Items and Get Supplies Identify which items would look good with that 3-D effect. Bottles, vases or items you’d like to transform into a focal point are good candidates. Only consider items that are in good shape. A broken vase or canister may not be something to upgrade. Toss the old and purchase a new one. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Clean the item (if possible) with hot soapy water and allow ample dry time before designing. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Avoid transforming family heirlooms into 3-D pieces. This will damage the integrity of the item and probably motivate your grandmother to write you out of her will. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Locate your hot glue gun and plenty of wax sticks. You will be writing sayings or creating designs with the hot glue gun on the item. Depending on how large of a design or word you plan to use will dictate how much glue you will need. Purchase a can (or more) of spray paint to cover the item. While shopping for spray paint explain to the hardware or craft store employee what you are trying to do to ensure you purchase the kind of spray paint that will deliver the best results. Some spray paints work better on certain surfaces. Create Your 3-D Item Decide what you want to write or draw. Do a sketch first to make sure you like the writing or design style. The good news about drawing with a hot glue gun is if you don’t like it, you can wipe away the hot glue immediately (you may have to peel it off if it dries). Heat up the hot glue gun and insert a wax stick. You want to make sure your glue gun is red hot before use. Draw/write your design on your item. It may be a little difficult to see the actual writing or design since the glue is transparent. Consider creating your design in a well lit area so you can see exactly what you are doing. Allow ample dry time for the glue gun design. Even allowing it to set for up to 24 hours is a good idea as painting over the wet glue could ruin your project. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Prepare an area for spray painting. Cover surfaces with newspaper and make sure the room is well ventilated. Consider completing the project outdoors if possible. Paint the object. Make sure your spray is even and fully covers the object. You may want to add a few coats of paint depending on the type of surface and item. Allow paint to dry before adding the item to your room décor. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Create-3D-Jars-and-Vases-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Finished.
